channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: No sign to use pedestrian underpass, 15th October
item.description:
GL51 Wasley Road unofficial crossing across Gloucester Road to Benhall side to access pub The National Hunt, no sign to use nearby underpass which clearly has been missed off the highways maintenance schedule, no hand rail, filthy, no lights, steps have weeds growing out of them, people will not use at night.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Campden Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic lights out of sync, 15th October
item.description:
PE Way onto roundabout. 2nd set of lights turn red before 1st set do resulting in blocked roundabout for cars crossing from Tewksbury road. Also Kingsditch Lane onto roundabout. 1st set turn green as the 2nd set turn red only allowing a few cars through resulting in queues right back down Wymans lane which means cars canâ€™t get out of Swindon road causing tailbacks there also.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tewkesbury Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Roxton Drive, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree Line Gap, 15th October
item.description:
There are trees all along the river chelt that the local community and wildlife very much enjoys as a slice of green in the town and surrounding industrial estate and housing. There's a gap of around 2/3 trees on the road facing side- i hear were knocked out by a car crash on the Millbrook roundabout years ago. But basically there is a gap right on the roundabout, which gets quite busy, and the noise and effect to the area is quite substantial. We see a lot of trees cut back on down by the local authority here, it would be fantastic to see a equal put back too. We absolute love the edition of the sliver birch to the Waitrose roundabout in the recent years. I suppose i don't need to go into the benefit a tree would also have on flood prevention, road noise screening and the wider environmental benefit. But i wanted to reach out to put the case forward. Is there any hope of filling in the line?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Honeybourne Way, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 15th October
item.description:
Severn Trent have visited my home because of fluvial flooding - they are dealing with thier man hole issue and as the house holder at 27 - I am requesting our drains/gutters are jetted due to their failiure to remove water from road and the back log this created on the manhole in my patio leading to flloding of patio/garden and garage. We are the last man hole on the sewer run and trherefore we always have the water problems. Thank You
Report on FixMyStreet
